result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Trevyn Ray Nelson-Blauvelt in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi with Lanie Krause in court for Trevyn Ray Nelson-Blauvelt.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF626 & 22CM564- Atty Schmidt was appointed to this matter.  Court reviews files and notes DE does qualify for PD on 22CF626 but one has not been appointed at this time. Atty Dolfi believes Atty Schmidt will be appointed on 22CF626.  JA to reach out to Atty Schmidt to get this matter scheduled next week.  Adjourned at 1:32 PM. bph
Review scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 07:45 am.
NOH STC 10-20-2022 returned by PO.  Not Deliverable as Addressed. Unable to forward. KEF
Status Conference on October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:03 PM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy    Defendant Trevyn Ray Nelson-Blauvelt in court, in custody.  Attorney Aaron Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin.  INCLUDES: 22CF626 & 22CM564.  Case 22CF626 originally set for Prelim.  Ms Schmidt represents DE in 22CM564. Court notes letter from PD Office indicating DE needs to contact their office.  Court finds good cause to extend time for hearing.  DE to contact the PD office on 10/21/22.  Adjourned: 1:08
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

The original document was titled: Pretrial Assessment Report
The original history event date is: 10-14-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report. Includes 22CF626 and 22CM564. olg

Includes 22CF626 and 22CM564.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

-I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C.N.M.,  B.L.H., A.M.A., C.M.B., J.R.N., and J.N..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:31 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court. Defendant Trevyn Ray Nelson-Blauvelt in court, in custody. Includes EFV cases 22CF626 and 22CM564 RW/INIT and SJN cases 22CM246 and 22CM427 RW. 22CF626 and 22CM564 RW/INIT: Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Enters NG plea in 22CM564. Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court reinstates bond in 22CM246 and 22CM427. Court sets SETC and PSC in 22CM246 and 22CM427. Court sets PH in 22CF626 and STC 22CM564 with Court Commissioner. Adjourned 01:42 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
